file_content.text: It's useless! This droid's nothing but a junk heap without replacement parts.
With all the droids up and running, we've got a fighting chance against those thugs. Thanks for helping out.
I've got your motivator coils; are your droids ready?
They're as ready as they can be. I should just be able to drop in the coils, and they'll be running.
We're not out of the woods, but at least with the droids to help out, we've got a fighting chance. Glad you made it back.
I said I'd bring you the motivator coils; I keep my promises.
I gave you my word.
It wasn't any big deal.
It was a huge deal for my men. Maybe we'll even survive this riot.
You're lucky I was bored.
We did fine on our own until the Empire came down on us. You do your part, we'll do ours.
This is a good start, but I've got more droids than this. Can you get a few more coils?
Still here, huh? Still waiting on those motivator coils.
Sorry, Master Jedi, didn't hear you. Crazy racket those convicts are making.
I can't take it, Major. Between the convicts shooting us and our equipment breaking, it's a wonder we're alive.
You guys should wear a badge or something--for a second I thought another convict got in. They've been shooting at us all day.
There's a hundred screaming crazies out there, all my men are hurt, and the warden droids that are supposed to help us don't function.
I can drive off the prisoners and buy you a little breathing room.
Let me handle the convicts.
It won't help--they'll just come back. If our droids were working, we'd have a chance, but they all need motivator coils.
They don't look that beat up, let me take a look at them.
I can help with the droids.
Unless you've got a pocket full of new motivator coils, you're not going to be much help--without them, these droids are worthless.
The blasted Mandalorians raided our supply depot and ran off with our extra coils, so we've got nothing.
Figure out how to deal.
Easy for you to say--you don't have a mob of blood-crazed prisoners screaming for your head.
Not to mention that the Mandalorians attacked and took all our motivator coils--the one thing that would get our droids working.
Mandos aren't like the other convicts--they're more like a military unit than a gang, even set up their own headquarters.
What are Mandalorians doing on Belsavis?
Mandalorians? Here?
They were captured after they wiped out some backwater planet. Real nasty, real resourceful.
Have you tried negotiating with them?
Maybe they'd make an exchange.
They don't negotiate--they shoot anybody who gets too close to their little base.
Mandos are no big threat.
Sounds like you've never seen them fight--imagine the rest of these murderers with military training.
They've even scavenged a bunch of old warden droids and turned them into turret defenses. That's why they took the coils.
You want to help? Break open those turrets the Mandos built and bring me the motivator coils. With those, these droids will be back online.
I'll have those coils back in your hands before nightfall.
Of course I'll help you.
Stay calm, and stay brave. I'll find the coils.
Of course I'll help you.
Neutralize the turrets and "requisition" the motivator coils, check. I'll be right back.
Of course I'll help you.
Sure, I'll get your coils--beats paying for them.
Of course I'll help you.
If you can pull it off, we'll have a chance, but I'll believe it when I see it.
I'll need to find their base.
The camp's near the remnants of the prison housing--the turrets guard the perimeter.
Be careful out there, the Mandos are going to go ballistic if you start breaking their toys.
Do it yourself. [Refuse quest]
We managed just fine before you brought the Empire down on us. We'll be okay now.
Another broken down droid--seems like nothing around here works right anymore.
